sen.j: 英子内親王（えいし/ひでこないしんのう、延喜21年（921年） - 天慶9年9月16日 (旧暦)（946年10月13日））は、平安時代中期の皇族。
sen.e: Imperial Princess Eishi (Hideko) (921-October 13, 946) was a member of the imperial family in the middle of the Heian period.
Imperial Princess Eishi (Hideko) (921-October 13, 946) was a member of the imperial family during the middle of the Heian period.
Imperial Princess Eishi (also known as Hideko) (921 - October 18, 946) was a member of the Imperial Family during the middle of the Heian period.
sen.cmt: also known as 補足用語統一グレゴリオ歴に変更

sen.e: she was a Saigu (Imperial Princess appointed to serve the deities of the Ise-jingu Shrine).
she was a Saigu (Imperial Princess appointed to serve the deities of the Ise-jingu Shrine).
She was a Saigu (Imperial Princess appointed to serve the deities of the Ise-jingu Shrine).

sen.j: 醍醐天皇の第16皇女で、母は更衣 (女官)藤原淑姫（参議藤原菅根女）。
sen.e: She was the sixteenth princess of Emperor Daigo, and her mother was a kisaragi (court lady) FUJIWARA no Yoshihime (daughter of Sangi (councilor), FUJIWARA no Sugane).
She was the sixteenth princess of Emperor Daigo, and her mother was a kisaragi (court lady) FUJIWARA no Yoshihime (daughter of Sangi - councilor, FUJIWARA no Sugane).
She was the sixteenth princess of Emperor Daigo, and her mother was a kisaragi (court lady) FUJIWARA no Yoshihime (daughter of Sangi - councilor, FUJIWARA no Sugane).

sen.j: 朱雀天皇・村上天皇らの異母姉妹で、同母兄弟に長明親王・兼明親王・源自明がいた。
sen.e: She was a sister to Emperor Suzaku and Emperor Murakami with the different mother, and Imperial Princess Nagaakira, Imperial Prince Kaneakira, and MINAMOTO no Yoriakira were her siblings with the same mother.

She was a sister to Emperor Suzaku and Emperor Murakami by a different mother, and Imperial Princess Nagaakira, Imperial Prince Kaneakira, and MINAMOTO no Yoriakira were her siblings by the same mother.

She was a sister to Emperor Suzaku and Emperor Murakami by a different mother, and Imperial Princess Nagaakira, Imperial Prince Kaneakira, and MINAMOTO no Yoriakira were her siblings by the same mother.

sen.j: 延長 (元号)8年（930年）9月内親王宣下を受け、天慶元年（938年）8月西三条第にて裳着を行う。
sen.e: In September 930, she was given the title of imperial princess, and went through Mogi (coming-of-age ceremony for girls) at Nishi Sanjo-tei residence in August 938.
In September 930, she was given the title of imperial princess, and she went through Mogi (coming-of-age ceremony for girls) at Nishi Sanjo-tei residence in August 938.
In September 930, she was given the title of imperial princess, and she went through Mogi (coming-of-age ceremony for girls) at Nishi Sanjo-tei residence in September 938.

sen.j: 同9年（946年）5月村上天皇の即位により伊勢斎宮に卜定された。
sen.e: When Emperor Murakami ascended the throne in May 946, she was designated as Ise Saigu (vestal virgin princess serving at Ise-jingu Shrine) by bokujo (to decide by fortunetelling).
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: When Emperor Murakami ascended the throne in May 946, she was designated as Ise Saigu (vestal virgin princess serving at Ise-jingu Shrine) by bokujo (decided by fortunetelling).
When Emperor Murakami ascended the throne in June 946, she was designated as Ise Saigu (vestal virgin princess serving at Ise-jingu Shrine) by bokujo (decided by fortunetelling).

sen.j: 群行しないまま同年没した。
sen.e: She passed away in the same year; she never went for Gunko (three years of purification for Saigu at Nonomiya, and returning to Ise).
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: She passed away in the same year; she never went for Gunko (three years of purification for Saigu at Nonomiya, and then returned to Ise.
She passed away in the same year; she never went for Gunko (three years of purification for Saigu at Nonomiya, and then returned to Ise).
She died at the age of twenty six.
She died at the age of twenty six.
She died at the age of twenty six.
